usa: The 1994 Northridge earthquake, striking the Northridge, Los Angeles area, killed fifty-seven people and leaving 20,000 others homeless; causing $20 billion in damage and being the costliest earthquake in U.S. history.<sup id="cite_ref-589" class="reference">[589]</sup>

The Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act, authorizing the Federal Assault Weapons Ban and the Violence Against Women Act, was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-590" class="reference">[590]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-591" class="reference">[591]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-592" class="reference">[592]</sup>
Republican Revolution: The Republican Party picked up 54 seats in the House and 8 seats in the Senate, being one of the largest shifts in party balance in U.S. congressional history.[593]
